report:
The month of October in Canberra 2012 was characterized by a cool to mild start, with a gradual warming trend towards the end. The average minimum temperature was around 7°C, while the maximum temperature ranged between 14°C and 28°C. Rainfall was mostly light to moderate, with a few instances of heavy rainfall. Evaporation was moderate, with a slight increase towards the end of the month. Sunshine hours were generally moderate to high, with a few days of partial cloud cover. Wind patterns were mostly westerly to northwesterly, with moderate speeds.

Based on the observed trends, I predict that November 2012 will start with a similar pattern to October, with a cool to mild start and a gradual warming trend. Rainfall is likely to remain light to moderate, with a possibility of some heavy rainfall events. Evaporation may continue to increase, and sunshine hours may remain moderate to high. Wind patterns will likely remain westerly to northwesterly, with moderate speeds.

It's worth noting that October 11 and 12 experienced significant rainfall, which is a bit out of the ordinary for Canberra during this time of the year. Additionally, October 27 had a relatively high temperature of 19.5°C, which was above average for the month. Overall, the weather in October was generally mild and pleasant, with a few days of cooler temperatures and some rain events.
